frameDefinitions: An entity is considered worthy of mention for their ability or influence among some Type of similar entities.
A Cognizer makes a judgment about an Evaluee.
A Communicator communicates a judgment of an Evaluee to an Addressee.

This is an abstract frame for durative activities, in which the Agent enters an ongoing state of the Activity, remains in this state for some Duration of Time, and leaves this state either by finishing or by stopping.
An Agent has done or omitted to do an Act or is responsible for the obtaining of a State_of_affairs, which a Judge deems to constitute a violation of an obligation or a moral guideline.
This  frame covers the descriptions of tastes and smells, and has one main frame element, Source.
frameExamples: Dali is one of the <t>great</t> artists of the 20th century.
JUDGMENT:  She <t>admired</t> Einstein for his character.
I <t>commended</t> his handling of the crisis.
Kim failed to fully <t>justify</t> his decision.
listRoleDefinitions: The kind of thing which is notable. This may be an event, place, item, or role and is plural.
The name of the notable entity.
The time during which the entity is considered notable.
The geographic area in which the entity is considered notable.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> makes the judgment. This role is typically expressed as the External Argument (or in a <ment>by</ment>-PP in passives).
Evaluee is the person or thing about whom/which a judgment is made. With verbs this role is typically expressed as Object:
Typically, there is a constituent expressing the <t>Reason</t> for the Judge's judgment. It is usually a <ment>for</ment>-PP, e.g.
<fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part that conveys the judgment made by the <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
The <fen>Communicator</fen> uses language in the written or spoken modality to convey his or her evaluation of the <fen>Evaluee</fen> to another person.
<fen>Medium</fen> identifies the physical or abstract setting in which the evaluation is conveyed.
<fen>Topic</fen> identifies the entity to which the proposition or propositions conveyed relate.
A judgment is made about the <fen>Evaluee</fen>  With verbs this role is typically expressed as Object:
<fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part that conveys the judgment made by the <fen>Communicator</fen>.
Typically, there is a constituent expressing the <t>Reason</t> for the <fen>Communicator</fen>'s judgment. It is usually a <ment>for</ment>-PP.
When the communication of the judgment takes place.
Where the communication of the judgment takes place.
This role identifies the <fen>Activity</fen> in which the  <fen>Agent</fen>  is engaged.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is engaged in the <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Activity</fen> occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Activity</fen> occurs.
The person or organization that  is held responsible for a prior <fen>Act</fen> or for a <fen>State_of_affairs</fen>.
An action  for which the <fen>Agent</fen> is held responsible, frequently one that the <fen>Agent</fen> has taken themself.
A <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> that the Agent is held responsible for.
The <fen>Time</fen> of the justifying event.
<fen>Perceptual_source</fen> is used for the entity that is being described. A recipe can stand in for a <fen>Perceptual_source</fen> which is a kind of food.
<fen>Sensory_attribute</fen> is used for words that describe the perception itself.
listRoleExamples: Shakespeare is one of the great <fex>poets</fex>.
<fex>Shakespeare</fex> is one of the great poets.
Bob Dylan is among the most notable musicians <fex>of the 20th century</fex>.
Dumas is one of the most notable authors <fex>in France</fex>.
<fex>The boss</fex> appreciates you for your diligence.
The boss appreciates <fex>you</fex> for your diligence.
I admire you <fex>for your intellect</fex>.
She viewed him with an appreciative <fex>gaze</fex>.
<fex>Jon</fex> belittled Madie to her colleagues.
Jon belittled Madie <fex>over the telephone</fex>.
Jon criticized Madie <fex>about her managerial style</fex>.
Jon belittled <fex>Madie</fex> to her colleagues.
She viewed him with a critical <fex>gaze</fex>.
Jon extolled Madie <fex>for her efforts</fex>.
He received critical acclaim <fex>last week</fex>.
He was belittled by his long-time friend <fex>in front of his family</fex>.
<fex>Smithers</fex> defended his decision by insisting that he had used his best judgment
Kim failed  to fully justify <fex>his decision</fex>.
The lawyers tried  to justify <fex>enormous punitive damages being paid to victims on a first-past-the-post system</fex> .
The almonds had a bitter <fex> taste</fex>.
